page.title: 02RELIGION
page.content: AN ISOLATED UPLAND CHURCH,LLANELIEU CHURCH WAS BUILT IN MEDIEVAL TIMES TO SERVE THE SCATTERED FARMING COMMUNITY, MUCH STILL REMAINS OF THE ORIGINAL STRUCTURE INCLUDING PART OF THE ROOD SCREEN, WHILE IT ALSO ACTS AS HOME FOR THE TWO CROSSES OF THE DARK AGES. TODAY ITS ROLE HAS BEEN LARGELY DESTROYED BY CHANGES IN FARMING PATTERNS WHICH HAVE REDUCED THE SIZE OF THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES AND BY MODERN TRANSPORT. IT IS STILL, WITH THE HELP OF GRANTS, KEPT OPEN AND IN GOOD REPAIR BUT ITS PASTORAL ROLE IS REPLACED BY TALGARTH PARISH WHICH SHARES ITS VICAR. ITS ROLE AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION IS MINIMISED BY ITS ISOLATION. IT HAS SERVED AS A SETTING FOR A TELEVISION PLAY. ITS FUTURE REMAINS UNCERTAIN; LARGELY REPLACED YET STILL VALUED FOR SENTIMENTAL REASONS AND HISTORICAL INTEREST.
